etymology.description: 扌(手) (shǒu, "hand") + 涅(涅) (niè, "mud") = hand action related to mud -> pinch
etymology.interpretation: The character 捏(捏) (niē, "pinch") combines 扌(手) (shǒu, "hand") to suggest a manual action, with 涅(涅) (niè, "mud") to indicate the sound component. Together, they imply the action of using one's hand to pinch or mold something, similar to handling mud.

examples.chinese: 他用手捏了一下火锅里的肉(他用手捏了一下火鍋裡的肉)。
examples.pinyin: Tā yòng shǒu niē le yīxià huǒguō lǐ de ròu.
examples.english: He pinched a piece of meat in the hot pot.

examples.chinese: 孩子用小手捏气球(孩子用小手捏氣球)，气球瞬间破裂(氣球瞬間破裂)。
examples.pinyin: Háizi yòng xiǎoshǒu niē qìqiú, qìqiú shùnjiān pòliè.
examples.english: The child pinched the balloon with his little hand, and the balloon burst instantly.

examples.chinese: 艺术家熟练地捏黏土(藝術家熟練地捏黏土)，雕刻出一尊精美的雕像(雕刻出一尊精美的雕像)。
examples.pinyin: Yìshùjiā shúliàn de niē niántǔ, diāokè chū yī zūn jīngměi de diāoxiàng.
examples.english: The artist skillfully pinched the clay, carving an exquisite statue.
